case_title: SHERA AND 2 Others vs The STATE
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Appeal No. 27 of 1977 and Jail Petition No. 49 of 1973; Criminal Appeal No. 452 of 1970
case_number: Criminal Appeal No. 27 of 1977 and Jail Petition No. 49 of 1973
complaint_summary: The complainant, Muhammad Akram, alleged that Shera, Anara (son of Dari), and Anara (son of Jahana), along with others, attacked Salehon with spears, causing his death. The motive was revenge for the murder of Dari, Shera's father, which occurred 10-12 years earlier.
investigation_summary: The FIR was lodged at P.S. Malikwal on the same day. Blood-stained spears were recovered from Anara (son of Jahana) and Anara (son of Dari) on April 1, 1968, and confirmed to have human blood. Broken pieces of a pitcher and blood-stained earth were secured from the crime scene.
judgment_summary: The Supreme Court upheld the convictions of Shera and Anara (son of Jahana) with death sentences and Anara (son of Dari) with transportation for life. The appeal was dismissed, confirming the High Court's reliance on ocular testimony, motive, and medical evidence.
punishment: Shera and Anara (son of Jahana) sentenced to death; Anara (son of Dari) sentenced to transportation for life.

high_court_verdict.bench: Division Bench of Lahore High Court
high_court_verdict.decision: Convictions upheld for appellants; retrial ordered for Jahana, Dari, and Rasula.

legal_arguments: Defense argued enmity over land ownership rights and questioned the credibility of eyewitnesses.
Prosecution relied on ocular testimony, motive, medical evidence, and recovery of blood-stained weapons.

defense_arguments.denial_of_involvement: Appellants claimed enmity over land ownership rights.
defense_arguments.alternative_motive: Suggested deceased was killed due to personal disputes involving his second wife.

witness_statement.Muhammad Akram: Observed the attack while proceeding to his Dera.
witness_statement.Muhammad Akbar: Saw the incident while returning from his Dera.
witness_statement.Muhammad: Claimed to be present near the scene for marriage-related errands.

key_evidence.motive: Revenge for the murder of Dari (father of Shera and Anara) in 1951.

majority_opinion.author: Muhammad Haleem
majority_opinion.summary: Ocular testimony corroborated by motive and medical evidence; appeal dismissed.

dissenting_opinion.author: Qaisar Khan
dissenting_opinion.summary: Ocular testimony unreliable; appellants acquitted due to benefit of doubt.

final_order: Appeal and Jail Petition dismissed in accordance with majority opinion.

legal_terms.Ocular Evidence: Eyewitness testimony used to establish facts.

words_and_phrases.Transportation for Life: A form of punishment involving exile or imprisonment for life.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved the murder of Salehon by Shera, Anara (son of Dari), and Anara (son of Jahana), motivated by revenge for the murder of Dari. The Supreme Court upheld the convictions based on credible eyewitness testimony, motive, and medical evidence. The appeal was dismissed.
